meanings.definition: Phosphofructokinases: enzymes that catalyze the phosphorylation of fructose 6-phosphate to fructose 1,6-bisphosphate in glycolysis.
meanings.sent1: The phosphofructokinases play a crucial role in converting fructose 6-phosphate to fructose 1,6-bisphosphate.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phosphofructokinases to understand how glycolysis works in cells.
meanings.sent3: The phosphofructokinases were so busy phosphorylating fructose 6-phosphate that they forgot to take a break!
meanings.sent4: In the complex dance of glycolysis, phosphofructokinases are the choreographers, guiding the transformation of fructose 6-phosphate.
meanings.sent5: Imagine phosphofructokinases as tiny workers diligently adding phosphate groups to fructose 6-phosphate molecules.
